item.title: Microsoft to refund customers for 365 subscription price hike after ACCC action
item.description: Microsoft apologises to customers and says it will refund them, after the consumer watchdog alleged the tech giant misled about 2.7 million Australians over subscription costs so they would remain on more expensive plans.

item.title: Man suffers stab wounds during citizens' arrest of knife-wielding man in Melbourne's CBD
item.description: Two bystanders have helped detain a man who was allegedly seen wielding a knife and behaving erratically in Melbourne's CBD.

item.title: Nick Kyrgios aims to play Australian Open after 'miracle' knee recovery
item.description: A revitalised Nick Kyrgios has revealed his shock plans to make a summer comeback and hopefully play the Australian Open in January.

item.title: Australia captain Pat Cummins says he is still trying to keep the second Ashes Test as a 'live option'
item.description: Pat Cummins says his return to bowling has gone better than expected, with Australia's captain still eyeing off a return for the second Ashes Test.

item.title: Sydney Swans AFLW part ways with inaugural coach Scott Gowans after missing finals
item.description: The Sydney Swans are in need of a new AFLW head coach after parting ways with Scott Gowans.

item.title: 'Conscious consumers' embrace of Australian goat meat presents a quality challenge
item.description: Producers will have to balance consistent supply with the ethical expectations of America's "conscious consumers" as international demand for wild-caught rangeland goat meat surges.

item.title: WA government to buy St John of God Mount Lawley Hospital, fund major hospital upgrades
item.description: A major upgrade of the Perth Convention and Exhibition Centre is axed to help pay for three major Perth and Mandurah hospital projects under a $1.5 billion health infrastructure fund.

item.title: Theatre-maker Lamine Sonko explores Senegalese cosmology in his latest show, Guewel
item.description: When Lamine Sonko arrived in Australia 20 years ago, audiences didn't understand his work. Now he is sharing the rituals and rhythms of Senegal with a willing crowd.

item.title: NSW Health to review regional hospital security after Tamworth guard bitten
item.description: The New South Wales health minister says he intends to review security powers at regional hospitals after four guards were injured at Tamworth.

item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Healthcare professionals accused of negligence in Diego Maradona's death to face fresh trial
item.description: The seven healthcare professionals accused of negligence in the death of Argentine soccer great Diego Maradona are facing a new trial after a mistrial last year.

item.title: Typhoon Kalmaegi leaves 114 dead and 127 missing in Philippines
item.description: The death toll from Typhoon Kalmaegi in the Philippines has risen as the storm gathers strength and heads towards Vietnam.

item.title: Prime minister confident social media ban will work and will empower parents
item.description: Anthony Albanese says he is confident Australia's social media age limit will be a success when it begins next month.

item.title: The potential use of fracking continues to divide West Australians, particularly in the Kimberley
item.description: As WA's EPA assesses a proposal to drill and frack in the Kimberley's Canning Basin, groups call for WA Labor to enforce a ban across the state.

item.title: Jake Weatherald's route to the Australian Ashes Test squad a path less trodden
item.description: Jake Weatherald could become the latest player to represent Australia in the Ashes following a superb 18 months in the Sheffield Shield. But his path to the Test squad has not been conventional.

item.title: Man charged with murder and coercive control after Claire Austin's death in Randwick unit
item.description: The 44-year-old is charged almost seven months after Claire Austin's death in Randwick.

item.title: Prince William joins Kylie Minogue, Shawn Mendes for green-carpeted Earthshot Prize awards in Rio de Janeiro
item.description: Prince William has joined Kylie Minogue and Shawn Mendes, along with a swag of world leaders and celebrities, for the annual Earthshot Prize awards in Rio de Janeiro.

item.title: Zak Brown says McLaren will not prioritise Oscar Piastri or Lando Norris for F1 title
item.description: McLaren's boss says he would rather Red Bull's Max Verstappen win the Formula 1 drivers' championship than prefer one of his racers over the other.

item.title: Taylor Swift sings about 'eldest daughter syndrome', but is it real?
item.description: Jess King says being the firstborn child in her family brought a weight of responsibility and she still struggles with feelings that she's "not doing enough".

item.description: Tasmanian Treasurer Eric Abetz has vowed to take "decisive action" to rein in the ballooning debt, but the "interim" state budget contains few major initiatives.

item.title: Cassowary wandering 150km from home in Queensland's Gulf Savannah baffles residents
item.description: Queensland's department of environment says it has no plans to relocate a cassowary spotted roaming the dry Gulf Savannah.

item.title: Hail and heavy rain batter West Australia's Great Southern and Wheatbelt region
item.description: Severe weather has swept through large parts of the Great Southern and Wheatbelt, causing significant damage to crops during the critical harvest period.

item.description: Brisbane will take on Hull Kingston Rovers in the World Club Challenge in late February with the NRL premiers confirming the return of the showpiece event.

item.description: Warren Tredrea's premiership teammate Josh Carr says he will always remain a Port Adelaide legend despite being sacked from the club's board last week.

item.description: Known for his generosity and a spectacular art gallery home filled with colourful works, Peter "Jungle" Phillips is remembered by those who loved him dearly.

item.description: "There will be a corner of this Parliament House that is forever Bob Katter," the prime minister said this week.

item.description: A Walgett Shire councillor stands down while investigations continue into an alleged assault at a bowling club.

item.title: The art of price baiting — how real estate agents lure buyers to auction
item.description: To advertise a property for $1 million, knowing it must sell above $1.3 million, is illegal. It is called underquoting, and in NSW it is rife, according to data analysis.

item.title: Boyfriend welcomes coronial findings about Simone Strobel's murder 20 years ago
item.description: The findings of a coronial inquest into the death of German backpacker Simone Strobel in Lismore in 2005 have been delivered.

item.title: Serial rapist Graham Kay pleads guilty to sexually touching Sydney schoolgirl without consent
item.description: Convicted rapist Graham Kay will remain in custody after sexually touching a 16-year-old girl in the Sydney CBD while on a strict supervision order.

item.description: The convicted killer, who cannot be named, showed no emotion as Ashley Gordon's family members confronted him one by one during a plea hearing at court.

item.description: Fosterville Gold Mine in central Victoria is approved to continue running until 2045 despite concerns from neighbours and environmental advocates.

item.description: Ms Pelosi was the first woman to serve as US speaker of the House of Representatives, and her decision will bring to an end a political career spanning four decades.

item.description: The main characters are dead. Some of those still around from the time maintain their rage, which has lasted through the decades, long after that election campaign.

item.title: Country Fire Service prepares for summer season with smoke but no fire
item.description: Ahead of bushfire season, the SA Country Fire Service's air operations teams clear out the cobwebs and take to the skies to simulate bushfires in the Flinders Ranges.

item.title: Hawks faced with fresh injury concerns after loss to Kangaroos in AFLW qualifying final
item.description: Injury-ravaged Hawthorn is counting the cost of its heavy loss to North Melbourne in the opening AFLW qualifying final.

item.title: Spring see-saw weather brings heat, storms and snow to eastern Australia
item.description: Australia's weather has been highly volatile during the past fortnight, and this weekend will serve up another smorgasbord of atmospheric variability.

item.title: Bilpin apple grower fears mystery failed crop could be linked to varroa mite
item.description: Across the Blue Mountains, apple farmers are noticing less fruit this season. Some are wondering if it's linked to varroa mite.

item.title: Unsettled weather forecast for Queensland with thunderstorms north-west to south-east
item.description: Storms are expected across a large part of inland Queensland, with the Darling Downs region set to cop another weekend of severe weather.

item.title: In Melbourne's west, residents say street violence has 'come to their door'
item.description: Five young people have died due to knife violence in two and a half years in the Melbourne suburb of Melton. Residents fear the situation is "out of hand".

item.title: Hundreds of US flights cancelled as government shutdown drags on
item.description: With politicians in a bitter stand-off over spending priorities, Congress has ground to a standstill.

item.title: One Piece defines gen Z protests from Madagascar to Indonesia
item.description: Youth demonstrations in Madagascar are the latest in a number of gen Z protests across parts of Asia, Africa and South America, and young people are galvanised to join some of the largest protests of their generation.

item.title: US, UK lift sanctions on Syrian president Ahmed al-Sharaa after UNSC decision
item.description: The United States and Britain remove sanctions on Syrian President Ahmad al-Sharaa, a day after the United Nations Security Council did the same.

item.title: England's Football Association bans Milutin Osmajić for nine matches over racial abuse
item.description: Montenegro striker Milutin Osmajić is suspended for nine matches for racially abusing an opponent during a match in England's second-tier Championship last season.

item.title: How colourism and social media abuse have roiled Pacific beauty pageants
item.description: Beauty pageants remain serious business in the Pacific, but contestants are thinking twice before entering due to online bullying and discrimination.

item.title: Private health insurance offered little relief for my dental woes
item.description: Do I walk away from private insurance and trust that health challenges will have me seen promptly enough in the public system?

item.title: James Watson, co-discoverer of DNA's double helix, dead at 97
item.description: James Watson, the controversial American biologist whose 1953 discovery of the structure of DNA ushered in the age of genetics, has died.

item.title: Oscar Piastri third behind Lando Norris in sprint qualifying at São Paulo F1 Grand Prix
item.description: Lando Norris strikes the first significant blow of the São Paulo Grand Prix weekend by outpacing Oscar Piastri to take pole for the sprint race.

item.title: Mildura council aims to take Melbourne's controversial Yellow Peril art in new tourism campaign
item.description: Mildura Rural City Council says it wants Melbourne's Yellow Peril art piece to be moved to the regional centre as part of a new tourism campaign.

item.title: Diagnosis of gestational diabetes rises 70 per cent in five years, linked to pregnant woman's age and weight
item.description: One in five pregnant women are diagnosed with the condition, which experts say is linked to age, weight and a lack of exercise.

item.title: Elon Musk’s win at Tesla shareholder meeting causes worry to some
item.description: The world's richest man's believers have once again agreed to enrich the Tesla boss to levels far beyond the realm of ordinary billionaires. But how much is enough?

item.title: Inside the race to restore Yass's unique 1939 art deco theatre
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Yass art deco cinema screens first film in 51 years amid ambitious restoration
item.description: More than five decades since its heritage cinema closed, movies have returned to the big screen in the NSW town of Yass as part of an ambitious volunteer-led project to revive the town's historic art deco theatre.

item.title: They dared to believe and now this amateur English cricket club is taking on Gambia
item.description: Dodgy souvlaki, forgotten bails, and schoolboy defeats — even so, this unlikely group of amateurs are off to play in Gambia.

item.title: Feral cat eradication on Christmas Island clashes with Malay culture
item.description: On a speck of land in the Indian Ocean, one of the world's most ambitious wars is being waged against feral cats. But not everyone is celebrating.

item.title: There are 377 feral cat traps on the island.
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Aryna Sabalenka to face Elena Rybakina in WTA Finals title decider
item.description: World number one Aryna Sabalenka books a showdown with Elena Rybakina, with both players eyeing off their first season-ending championship win.

item.title: Car driven into Mentone tobacco store and set alight, forcing residents to evacuate
item.description: Residents were forced to evacuate their homes after a car was driven into a store and set alight in Melbourne's south-east.

item.title: Former prince Andrew's ex-wife Sarah Ferguson faces uncertainty after 30 years of bad headlines
item.description: From selling access to Andrew for £500,000 to dodgy dealings with Jeffrey Esptein, Sarah Ferguson has been creating headlines for all the wrong reasons for three decades.

item.title: Albury's Macquarie Textiles celebrated for decades of manufacturing
item.description: Textile manufacturing took Albury's work to the Opera House, federal parliament, the Olympics and beyond.

item.title: Compromise on WA's GST deal not an option, Treasurer Rita Saffioti says
item.description: When it comes to Western Australia's slice of the GST pie, the state government is making no apologies for ruffling the feathers of other jurisdictions.

item.title: The first Wright Brothers invented the airplane, but these two are creating comics for kids
item.description: When boys write their own comics, they are bound to be full of fart jokes, stinky-eyed butt dragons and lots of crazy superpowers.

item.title: This punchy olive and feta salad will lift any meal - ABC News
item.description: With a mix of marinated olives, red onion, capsicum and creamy feta, tossed with fresh herbs and a zesty lemon-garlic dressing, this salad pairs perfectly with grilled meats, seafood or a mezze spread.

item.title: Queensland Health reviews Gold Coast mental health service after youth suicides
item.description: The review comes after the suicides of two young people in the past five years who received treatment at the service in Robina.

item.title: Amyl and the Sniffers, Tame Impala, Rüfüs Du Sol secure 2026 Grammy nominations
item.description: Amyl and the Sniffers, Tame Impala and Rüfüs Du Sol will represent Australia at the 68th Annual Grammy Awards next year. Here is the full list of nominees.

item.title: Kangaroos focus on 'wonderful opportunity' in final Ashes Test against England at Headingley
item.description: The Kangaroos may hold an unassailable 2-0 lead in the Ashes series, but they have not been completely satisfied with their performances in England.

item.title: Police officer stabbed with sword in Grasmere, man charged with attempted murder
item.description: A 20-year-old man allegedly threw a spear at police officers before stabbing a probationary constable in the leg with a sword in Sydney's south-west.

item.title: Calls for better safety awareness after drowning at Margaret River surfing mecca
item.description: Sean Lennon was a trained lifeguard who spent years surfing Margaret River's iconic surf breaks. His death earlier this week has sparked calls for better safety from the broader surfing community.

item.title: Inquest hears of communication breakdown between corrections, health staff before death in custody
item.description: A coronial inquest into the death in custody of a Darwin prisoner has heard prison officers ignored concerns about the "comatose" man being placed alone in a cell.

item.title: Graham Richardson, former Labor powerbroker, dies aged 76
item.description: The PM leads tributes for the former minister who was a political powerbroker from the time he dived headlong into Labor's factional brawls in the 1960s to his final days.

item.title: Sudan's crisis has entered a dramatic new phase — but it started years ago
item.description: The latest chapter in Sudan's civil war has captured the world's attention. To understand what's happening now it helps to understand some of the country's history.

item.title: Surge in discarded syringes on streets of Kalgoorlie-Boulder amid meth 'epidemic'
item.description: There has been a massive surge in the number of discarded syringes being collected from the streets of Kalgoorlie-Boulder, with more than 5,323 so far this year.

item.title: Plan to save sacred Millstream aquifer welcomed amid water sustainability concerns
item.description: With sacred springs and water holes in northern WA drying up, the WA government decides to relocate where it is extracting groundwater from.

item.title: Inside the debate over the glass elevator Bali is building on 'world's most beautiful beach'
item.description: A new addition to Kelingking Beach has locals and tourists in an uproar, deeply dividing many along Bali's tested fault line — development versus environmental conservation.

item.title: Fairlie Arrow abduction hoax: Why the Gold Coast singer faked her own kidnapping
item.description: Gold Coast singer Fairlie Arrow disappeared from her home in 1991. As a police kidnapping investigation unfolded and media attention ramped up, Arrow had to admit it was all a hoax.

item.title: New Zealand's Shanice Parker to face Australia in Pacific Cup final in Sydney
item.description: Shanice Parker is the daughter of a Jillaroos World Cup player, but meeting her biological father as a teenager has prompted her to represent New Zealand.

item.title: Re-entering housing market after divorce hard for many due to loss of shared income
item.description: Rising house prices and lower incomes due to caring for children can make it especially difficult for women to re-enter the housing market after a divorce.

item.title: Deepfake AI ad featuring WA Premier Roger Cook prompts latest scam warning
item.description: WA's consumer watchdog says scams are getting more sophisticated and cheaper to make, as an AI video of state premier Roger Cook sparks new concerns.

item.title: Typhoon Kalmaegi rages across Vietnam as the Philippines prepares for a new storm
item.description: Typhoon Kalmaegi left hundreds dead and as Filipinos are bracing for more extreme conditions as they mourn their loved ones and pick up the pieces.

item.title: Community devastated after freight train kills one-year-old girl near Narrabri
item.description: Police say the one-year-old girl was playing with other children when she was clipped by a freight train near Narrabri, on the New South Wales north-western slopes.

item.title: Health authorities issue a nationwide recall of various alfalfa sprouts due to salmonella outbreak
item.description: Salmonella symptoms usually start six to 72 hours after exposure to the bacteria and usually last for four to seven days.

item.title: Carlton beats West Coast by 41 points in AFLW elimination final at Princes Park
item.description: Carlton stuns West Coast with a dominant AFLW finals win, as Mia Austin honours her late cousin Ben with an emotional goal at Princes Park.

item.title: Police allowed neo-Nazi protest outside NSW parliament
item.description: A neo-Nazi rally outside the NSW parliament on Saturday morning was deemed "authorised" because police had chosen not to oppose the public assembly.

item.title: India wins T20 series against Australia after washout at the Gabba
item.description: Stormy weather ensures only 4.5 overs are bowled in the fifth and final T20 match between Australia and India in Brisbane.

item.title: Police investigating if teen suspect in Indonesia mosque explosion was radicalised
item.description: Almost 30 people, mostly school students, are being treated in hospital after at least two explosions at a North Jakarta mosque during prayers on Friday.

item.title: UPS and FedEx ground MD-11 cargo planes after deadly Kentucky crash
item.description: The US firms say they are grounding their fleets of McDonnell Douglas MD-11 planes "out of an abundance of caution" after 14 people were killed earlier this week.

item.title: Pakistan-Afghanistan peace talks fail in Istanbul following deadly October border clashes
item.description: The two-day talks were the third round of peace negotiations between the countries.

item.title: Israel identifies latest hostage body as Lior Rudaeff, as families await five more
item.description: Five deceased Israeli hostages are yet to be returned as part of the ceasefire agreement with Hamas.

item.title: Australia secure 3-0 Ashes whitewash with 22-point win over England in third Test
item.description: The Kangaroos have secured a 3-0 Ashes victory with Harry Grant leading the way in a big win over England at Headingley.

item.title: F1 Brazil qualifying: Oscar Piastri crashes out of Formula 1 São Paulo sprint race, Lando Norris wins ahead of grand prix qualifying
item.description: Oscar Piastri's torrid second half of the Formula 1 season has continued in São Paulo, crashing out of the sprint race and watching title rival Lando Norris win.

item.title: Wallabies vs Italy rugby union Test live updates — blog, scores and stats from Udine
item.description: After a short-lived career with the Gold Coast Titans, Carter Gordon plays his first Test for the Wallabies since the 2023 Rugby World Cup. Follow live.
